content.webTitle: See more of India by rail

fields.headline: See more of India by rail
fields.bodyText: The Royal Orient is a seven-day rail tour of the cities of Rajasthan and Gujarat, starting and ending in Delhi, with visits to majestic forts, the Gandhi Ashram in Ahmedabad, the hilltop jain temples of Shatrunjaya and the Amber Palace in Jaipur. S.D. Enterprises (020 8903 3411) organises trips from £835pp, with accommodation onboard, breakfast and some meals. Flights from London can be arranged for around £500. The Darjeeling Toy Train, officially the Darjeeling Himalayan Railway, is a steam engine from 1881 that heaves passengers 7,000 feet into the Himalayas from Ghoom to Darjeeling. The journey is included in a seven-night package with Western Oriental (020 7313 6600; www.westernoriental.com), including accommodation at Windamere Hotel in Darjeeling, and a visit to Tiger Hill to watch the sun rise over Mount Everest, plus return flights from Heathrow to Delhi and on to Bagdogra, from where you are driven through teak forest and tea plantations to Darjeeling. From £1,320pp. The epic Palace on Wheels trip focuses on Rajasthan and gives a taste of India in exquisite luxury. A 16-day trip with Great Rail Journeys (01904 521940; www.greatrail.com) includes eight days aboard the train with excursions and meals in unique settings - dinner in the pink city of Jaipur, an elephant ride to the Palace of Amber, lunch in Jodhpur in the Royal Palace of the Maharajas of Jodhpur, and a visit to the Taj Mahal. The first three nights are in Delhi, then visit the beautiful hill station of Shimla. Departures 13 April and 21 September 2005, from £2,900 with full-board rail travel, half board in hotels and flights from London.
